section.docs:
Many resources have their own feed or timeline. The feed is composed of different activities. Pretty much everything in the system generates activities. You can reconstruct these activities to create a timeline for each thing in the system.
And activity can be associated with anything in the system. Each one has a timestamp, the user who is responsible for it, tags describing it, and the associated objects.
You can get the feed for any resource you can read. There are no interactions with the activities. You may only retrieve the feed. The server will add the activities to all the right feeds. You do not have to worry about any of this.
Different activities are discussed in their own section. The following sections list the events and their associated tags.

section.title: Call List Activities
section.docs: A new activity is generated when the call list is added. `created`

section.title: Campaign Activities
section.docs:
A new activity is generated when any of these things happen:
1. A campaign is added: `created` 2. A campaign is assigned / reassigned: `assigned` 3. A contact is added to a campaign: `contact_added` 4. A contact is removed from a campaign: `contact_removed` 5. Someone follows the campaign: `followed`

section.title: Contact Activities
section.docs:
A new activity is generated when any of these things happen:
1. When a contact is added: `created` 2. When a contact is assigned (or reassigned): `assigned` 3. When a contact becomes a lead: `became_lead` 4. When a contact becomes a prospect: `became_prospect` 5. When a contact becomes an opportunity: `became_opportunity` 6. When a contact becomes a customer: `became_customer` 7. When a contact becomes a dead end: `became_dead_end` 8. Someone follows the campaign: `followed`

section.title: Deal Activities
section.docs:
A new activity is generated when any of these things happen:
1. A deal is added: `created` 2. A deal is assigned/reassigned: `assigned` 3. A deal is reopened: `pending` 4. A deal is closed: `closed` 5. A deal is paid: `paid` 6. A deal is rejected: `rejected` 7. Someone follows the deal: `followed`

section.title: Message Activities
section.docs: A new activity is generated whenever a message is sent: `created`

section.title: Meeting Activities
section.docs:
A new activity is generated when any of these things happen:
1. A meeting is added: `created` 2. A meeting is rescheduled: `rescheduled` 3. A meeting is cancelled: `cancelled` 4. An invitation is confirmed: `confirmed` 5. An invitation is rejected: `rejected`

section.title: Note Activities
section.docs: A new activity is generated whenever a note is added: `created`

section.title: Phone Call Activities
section.docs: A new activity is generated whenever a phone call is made: `created`

section.title: Todo Activities
section.docs:
A new activity is generated whenever any of these things happen:
1. A todo is added: `created` 2. A todo is assigned/reassigned: `assigned` 3. A todo is finished: `finished`

section.title: Routes & Permission
section.docs:
* `GET /users/:id/feed` * `GET /contact/:id/feed` * `GET /deal/:id/feed` * `GET /campaign/:id/feed` * `GET /group/:id/feed`
You can retrieve the feed for any resource you can access. Refer to the documentation for each resource to see how access is determined

section.title: Format
section.docs:
Activities are formatted differently than other resources. They have two attributes: `owner` and `reference`.
There are also `kind` and `tag` attributes. `kind` is what type of record it's associated with (todo, contact, or deal etc). Then `tag` is used to describe that action happened. It may not always be an action, but just a general description of the event.
There is also a `timestamp` that corresponds to when the action happened. Example, when the email was sent or when the contact was added.
Also, the full objects are given. This is so you can retrieve the feed and not have to make other request to fetch the associated objects. The server assumes you'll need to show the activity right away so all the data is given.
Formats for the `owner` and `reference` follow the formats describing their specific sections. The example shows an activity done by a user about a todo.
